Data from the Singer et al. paper on survey incentives
sid:  id for the survey
m:  mode (-.5 if telephone, .5 if face-to-face)
r:  response rate in the survey condition
t:  timing (0 if no incentive, -.5 if given after the survey, .5 if given before the survey)
f:  form (0 if no incentive, -.5 if gift, .5 if cash)
r.dif:  difference in response rate compared to lowest-value incentive condition in that survey
v:  value of incentive (in 1999 dollars)
v.dif:  differenece in incentive value compared to lowest-value incentive condition in that survey
b:  burden (-.5 if low-burden survey, .5 if high-burden survey)
 
   sid    m    r    t    f r.dif          v      v.dif    b 
 1  20 -0.5 0.75  0.0  0.0    NA   0.000000         NA -0.5
